children.subject: I'm a concurrent enrollment student who took 61A and Ai'ed in the past (last 2 semesters respectively). Since we now have to receive at least 1 unit, will I still be able to AI this fall? Is there any way around receiving a unit? Thanks.

history.content:
Hi everyone!

CS 61A’s academic intern’s (formerly known as "lab assistant") interest form is now up and open.

With the class growing every year, we’d love to have your help to continue scaling the class to support as many people as we can.

 

If you're interested, then:

1. Fill out this quick, non-binding interest form: links.cs61a.org/ai-interest

2. Sign up for the Fall 2019 Academic Interning Piazza: piazza.com/berkeley/fall2019/cs97a

 

Academic interns are former 61A students who mainly help run office hours and labs. We welcome anyone who has received a B or higher in CS 61A to be an academic intern.  

 

Responsibilities include (per unit per week):

- 1 lab a week (1.5 hours)

- 1 office hour a week (1 hours)

- 1 hour for prep time 

- 0.5 hour for pedagogy practice/reflection a week (bCourses and/or in-person meeting with TA)

 

Please note that starting this Fall, the EECS department is also requiring all academic interns to be enrolled in mandatory 1-unit bCourses online section (20-30 minute per week for reflections + pedagogy support). To supplement this, 61A is also introducing a new “family” system to help integrate Academic Interns into course staff. There will be six 30-minute meetings a semester with a TA that will correspond with the online bCourses.

 

Join the academic intern family if you're interested in:

1. Reinforcing what you've learned

2. Helping students the way you were helped in 61A

3. Becoming a better teacher (most TAs start as academic interns!)

4. Being a part of the CS teaching community!

 

You will receive at least 1 unit for Academic Interning, and can receive more depending on number of hours worked.

It is 1 unit of credit for every 3 hours per week, and this credit is graded on a P/NP basis. 

 

There will be an EECS-wide Academic Intern Orientation at date/time TBA.

 

The CS 61A Academic Intern Orientation is set for Saturday August 31, 12-1:30 PM in HP Auditorium. 

New academic interns are required to attend. If you absolutely cannot, please indicate so in the form.

 

Join the Piazza for academic interning to receive future announcements: https://piazza.com/berkeley/fall2019/cs97a
